entry.title: Episode 6 - part 1 - setup Spree 1-3-stable
entry.content:
Shownotes

ruby 1.9.3, I use rbenv

Install Rails and ImageMagick gem install rails brew install imagemagick

Create a new rails app with ActiveRecord and rSpec rails new mtgspree -m http://railswizard.org/fb4911f700fd7f21213d.rb -T

Add spree 1-3-stable branch to Gemfile. gem "spree", github: "spree/spree", branch: "1-3-stable" Run the install generator, skip the sample data. rails g spree:install --sample=false

Add spree_auth_devise 1-3-stable branch to Gemfile gem 'spree_auth_devise', github: "spree/spree_auth_devise", branch: "1-3-stable" Install and run the migrations rake railties:install:migrations rake db:migrate

You can also run rake spree_auth:install:migrations rake db:migrate

Set the correct user_class in config/initializers/spree.rb

Spree.user_class = "Spree::User"

Create an admin user rake spree_auth:admin:create

Next episode will focus on deploying this application to DigitalOcean using Cloud66

entry.title: Spree E-Commerce Shop from scratch to deployment - series
entry.content:
After a few months the SpreeCasts show will continue! This time we will build a shop from scratch til deployment and further.

The shop will be the base shop for all future episodes and will be 100% open source. The shop will be selling Magic the Gathering cards and will be hosted at MtG Spree.

In the first episode I will create a 1.3 Spree shop using the gems from git for Spree and for the spree_auth_devise extension as well.

The next episode will show you how to deploy this shop to a number of blazing fast servers at Digital Oceanusing Cloud66

I will be using PostgreSQL as the database using Postgresapp and rSpec for testing.

Feel free to add suggestions and request in the comments for the future episodes.
